method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the 20 most recent statuses, including retweets if they exist, from non-protected users.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the 20 most recent statuses, including retweets if they exist, posted by the authenticating user and the user's they follow.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the 20 most recent statuses posted by the authenticating user. It is also possible to request another user's timeline by using the screen_name or user_id parameter.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the 20 most recent mentions (status containing @username) for the authenticating user.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the 20 most recent retweets posted by the authenticating user.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the 20 most recent retweets posted by the authenticating user's friends.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the 20 most recent tweets of the authenticated user that have been retweeted by others.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Show user objects of up to 100 members who retweeted the status.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Show user ids of up to 100 users who retweeted the status.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a single status, specified by the id parameter below. The status's author will be returned inline.

param.name: status
param.default: Posting from @apigee's API test console. It's like a command line for the Twitter API!

method.name: POST
method.doc: Updates the authenticating user's status. Requires the status parameter specified below. Request must be a POST. A status update with text identical to the authenticating user's current status will be ignored to prevent duplicates.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Destroys the status specified by the required ID parameter. The authenticating user must be the author of the specified status.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Retweets a tweet. Requires the id parameter of the tweet you are retweeting. Returns the original tweet with retweet details embedded.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns up to 100 of the first retweets of a given tweet.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns extended information of a given user, specified by ID or screen name as per the required id parameter. The author's most recent status will be returned inline.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Return up to 100 users worth of extended information, specified by either ID, screen name, or combination of the two. The author's most recent status (if the authenticating user has permission) will be returned inline.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Runs a search for users similar to Find People button on Twitter.com. The results returned by people search on Twitter.com are the same as those returned by this API request. Only the first 1000 matches are available.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Access to Twitter's suggested user list. This returns the list of suggested user categories. The category can be used in the users/suggestions/category endpoint to get the users in that category.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Access the users in a given category of the Twitter suggested user list. It is recommended that end clients cache this data for no more than one hour.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Access the profile image in various sizes for the user with the indicated screen_name. If no size is provided the normal image is returned.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of the 20 most recent direct messages sent to the authenticating user. The XML and JSON versions include detailed information about the sending and recipient users.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of the 20 most recent direct messages sent by the authenticating user. The XML and JSON versions include detailed information about the sending and recipient users.

param.name: text
param.default: Check it out... I'm sending this direct message from Apigee's test console for Twitter!

method.name: POST
method.doc: Sends a new direct message to the specified user from the authenticating user. Requires both the user and text parameters. Request must be a POST. Returns the sent message in the requested format when successful.

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Destroys the direct message specified in the required ID parameter. The authenticating user must be the recipient of the specified direct message.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Allows the authenticating users to follow the user specified in the ID parameter. Returns the befriended user in the requested format when successful. Returns a string describing the failure condition when unsuccessful. If you are already friends with the user an HTTP 403 will be returned.

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Allows the authenticating users to unfollow the user specified in the ID parameter. Returns the unfollowed user in the requested format when successful. Returns a string describing the failure condition when unsuccessful.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Tests for the existence of friendship between two users. Will return true if user_a follows user_b, otherwise will return false. Also try the friendship/show method, which gives even more information with a single call!

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns detailed information about the relationship between two users.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns an array of numeric IDs for every user who has a pending request to follow the authenticating user.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns an array of numeric IDs for every user who has a pending request to follow the authenticating user.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns an array of numeric IDs for every user the specified user is following.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns an array of numeric IDs for every user following the specified user.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns an HTTP 200 OK response code and a representation of the requesting user if authentication was successful; returns a 401 status code and an error message if not. Use this method to test if supplied user credentials are valid.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the remaining number of API requests available to the requesting user before the API limit is reached for the current hour. Calls to rate_limit_status do not count against the rate limit. If authentication credentials are provided, the rate limit status for the authenticating user is returned. Otherwise, the rate limit status for the requester's IP address is returned. Learn more about theREST API rate limiting.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the lists of the specified (or authenticated) user. Private lists will be included if the authenticated user is the same as the user whose lists are being returned.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the lists the specified (or authenticated) user has been added to.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the lists the specified (or authenticated) user follows.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the specified list. Private lists will only be shown if the authenticated user owns the specified list.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns tweet timeline for members of the specified list.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Creates a new list for the authenticated user. Note that you can't create more than 20 lists per account.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Updates the specified list. The authenticated user must own the list to be able to update it.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Deletes the specified list. The authenticated user must own the list to be able to destroy it.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the members of the specified list. Private list members will only be shown if the authenticated user owns the specified list.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Check if the specified user is a member of the specified list.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Add a member to a list. The authenticated user must own the list to be able to add members to it.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Adds multiple members to a list, by specifying a comma-separated list of member ids or screen names. The authenticated user must own the list to be able to add members to it.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Removes the specified member from the list. The authenticated user must be the list's owner to remove members from the list.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the subscribers of the specified list. Private list subscribers will only be shown if the authenticated user owns the specified list.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Check if the specified user is a subscriber of the specified list.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Subscribes the authenticated user to the specified list.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Unsubscribes the authenticated user from the specified list.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Sets one or more hex values that control the color scheme of the authenticating user's profile page on twitter.com.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Updates the authenticating user's profile image. Note that this method expects raw multipart data, not a URL to an image. Must be a valid GIF, JPG, or PNG image of less than 700 kilobytes in size. Images with width larger than 500 pixels will be scaled down.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Updates the authenticating user's profile background image. Note that this method expects raw multipart data, not a URL to an image. Must be a valid GIF, JPG, or PNG image of less than 800 kilobytes in size. Images with width larger than 2048 pixels will be forceably scaled down.

param.name: description
param.default: Free API analytics and protection for API providers and consumers.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Sets values that users are able to set under the "Account" tab of their settings page. Only the parameters specified will be updated.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the 20 most recent favorite statuses for the authenticating user or user specified by the ID parameter in the requested format.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Favorites the status specified in the ID parameter as the authenticating user. Returns the favorite status when successful.

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Un-favorites the status specified in the ID parameter as the authenticating user. Returns the un-favorited status in the requested format when successful.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Enables device notifications for updates from the specified user. Returns the specified user when successful.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Disables notifications for updates from the specified user to the authenticating user. Returns the specified user when successful.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Blocks the user specified in the ID parameter as the authenticating user. Destroys a friendship to the blocked user if it exists. Returns the blocked user in the requested format when successful. You can find out more about blocking in theTwitter Support Knowledge Base .

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Un-blocks the user specified in the ID parameter for the authenticating user. Returns the un-blocked user in the requested format when successful.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns if the authenticating user is blocking a target user. Will return the blocked user's object if a block exists, and error with a HTTP 404 response code otherwise.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns an array of user objects that the authenticating user is blocking.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns an array of numeric user ids the authenticating user is blocking.

method.name: POST
method.doc: The user specified in the id is blocked by the authenticated user and reported as a spammer.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the authenticated user's saved search queries.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Retrieve the data for a saved search owned by the authenticating user specified by the given id.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Creates a saved search for the authenticated user.

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Destroys a saved search for the authenticated user. The search specified by id must be owned by the authenticating user.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the locations that Twitter has trending topic information for. The response is an array of "locations" that encode the location's WOEID and some other human-readable information such as a canonical name and country the location belongs in.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the top 10 trending topics for a specific location Twitter has trending topic information for. The response is an array of "trend" objects that encode the name of the trending topic, the query parameter that can be used to search for the topic on Search, and the direct URL that can be issued against Search. This information is cached for five minutes, and therefore users are discouraged from querying these endpoints faster than once every five minutes.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Search for places that can be attached to a statuses/update. Given a latitude and a longitude pair, an IP address, or a name, this request will return a list of all the valid places that can be used as the place_id when updating a status.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Locates places near the given coordinates which are similar in name.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given a latitude and a longitude, searches for up to 20 places that can be used as a place_id when updating a status.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Find out more details of a place that was returned from the geo/reverse_geocode method.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Creates a new place at the given latitude and longitude.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the string "ok" in the requested format with a 200 OK HTTP status code.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns Twitter's' Terms of Service in the requested format. These are not the same as the Developer Terms of Service.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns Twitter's Privacy Policy in the requested format.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the top ten topics that are currently trending on Twitter. The response includes the time of the request, the name of each trend, and the url to the Twitter Search results page for that topic.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the current top 10 trending topics on Twitter. The response includes the time of the request, the name of each trending topic, and query used on Twitter Search results page for that topic.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the top 20 trending topics for each hour in a given day.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the top 30 trending topics for each day in a given week.

method.name: GET
method.doc:
Returns the 20 most recent statuses posted by the authenticating user and that user's friends. This is the equivalent of /timeline/home on the Web.

Note: Retweets will not appear in the friends_timeline for backwards compatibility. If you want retweets included use Twitter REST API Method: statuses home_timeline.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Creates a new list for the authenticated user. Accounts are limited to 20 lists.

method.name: GET
method.doc: List the lists of the specified user. Private lists will be included if the authenticated users is the same as the user whose lists are being returned.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Updates the specified list.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Show the specified list. Private lists will only be shown if the authenticated user owns the specified list.

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Deletes the specified list. Must be owned by the authenticated user.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Show tweet timeline for members of the specified list.

method.name: GET
method.doc: List the lists the specified user has been added to.

method.name: GET
method.doc: List the lists the specified user follows.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the members of the specified list.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Add a member to a list. The authenticated user must own the list to be able to add members to it. Lists are limited to having 500 members.

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Removes the specified member from the list. The authenticated user must be the list's owner to remove members from the list.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Adds multiple members to a list, by specifying a comma-separated list of member ids or screen names. The authenticated user must own the list to be able to add members to it.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Check if a user is a member of the specified list.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the subscribers of the specified list.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Make the authenticated user follow the specified list.

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Unsubscribes the authenticated user form the specified list.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Check if the specified user is a subscriber of the specified list.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Search for places (cities and neighborhoods) that can be attached to a statuses/update. Given a latitude and a longitude pair, or an IP address, return a list of all the valid cities and neighborhoods that can be used as a place_id when updating a status. Conceptually, a query can be made from the user's location, retrieve a list of places, have the user validate the location he or she is at, and then send the ID of this location up with a call to statuses/update. There are multiple granularities of places that can be returned -- "neighborhoods", "cities", etc. At this time, only United States data is available through this method. This is the recommended method to use find places that can be attached to statuses/update. Unlike geo/reverse_geocode which provides raw data access, this endpoint can potentially re-order places with regards to the user who is authenticated.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Ends the session of the authenticating user, returning a null cookie. Use this method to sign users out of client-facing applications like widgets.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Sets which device Twitter delivers updates to for the authenticating user. Sending none as the device parameter will disable IM or SMS updates.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a user's friends, each with current status inline. They are ordered by the order in which the user followed them, most recently followed first, 100 at a time. (Please note that the result set isn't guaranteed to be 100 every time as suspended users will be filtered out.) Use the cursor option to access older friends. With no user specified, request defaults to the authenticated user's friends. It's also possible to request another user's friends list via the id, screen_name or user_id parameter.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the authenticating user's followers, each with current status inline. They are ordered by the order in which they followed the user, 100 at a time. (Please note that the result set isn't guaranteed to be 100 every time as suspended users will be filtered out.) Use the cursor option to access earlier followers.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns tweets that match a specified query.
